1. Preparare il Brodo Vegetale (1 ora prima)

2. Tostare il Riso (5 min)

Procedura:

  • Casseruola larga a fondo spesso (NO antiaderente per risotto!)

  • Fuoco MEDIO

  • Soffriggere 3-4 min (deve diventare trasparente, NO dorata!)
  • Aggiungere riso Carnaroli 320g
  • Tostare 2-3 min mescolando

  • Sigilla l'amido esterno
  • Cottura uniforme
  • Chicco rimane al dente

ERRORE: Tostare troppo = riso bruciato, amaro!

3. Sfumare con Vino Bianco (2 min)

Procedura:

  • Riso tostato
  • Alzare fiamma a ALTA
  • Versare 100ml vino bianco secco
  • Mescolare vigorosamente

4. Cuocere il Risotto (16-18 min)

LA PARTE PI√ô IMPORTANTE!

Procedura:

  • Fuoco MEDIO (costante!)
  • Primo mestolo brodo bollente (150-200ml)
  • Mescolare delicatamente ma costantemente
  • Quando brodo assorbito: Aggiungere altro mestolo
  • Ripetere per 16-18 minuti totali
  • Assaggiare dopo 14 min: chicco deve essere ancora duro al centro
  • A 16-17 min: Chicco al dente perfetto (resistenza leggera al morso)

5. Mantecatura (3 min) - IL MOMENTO MAGICO!

Procedura mantecatura stellata:

  • Spegnere fuoco (SEMPRE fuori fuoco!)
  • Aggiungere burro freddo 60g a cubetti

  • Obiettivo: Cremoso, vellutato, "all'onda"

  • Inclina padella: risotto scivola lento come lava

ERRORE #2: Poco burro/Parmigiano = Risotto asciutto, piatto!

ERRORE #3: Parmigiano pre-grattugiato = Grumi, non fonde!

6. Impiattare e Servire

  • Piatti fondi CALDI (scaldare prima!)
  • Versare risotto al centro

  • Spolverare Parmigiano Reggiano 50g (generoso!)

Parmigiano Risotto: The Creamy Recipe

The King of Risottos

Parmigiano Reggiano Risotto is the most elegant and refined risotto of Italian cuisine. Simple in ingredients (only 5!), complex in execution, sublime in result. A dish that separates cooks from great chefs.

Why is it difficult? There are no strong flavors masking mistakes. Only rice, broth, butter, Parmigiano. Technique must be PERFECT.

Ingredients (4 people)

Essential

  • ‚úÖ Carnaroli rice: 320g (80g/person) - THE BEST!
  • ‚úÖ Vegetable broth: 1.2-1.5 liters (homemade!)
  • ‚úÖ Parmigiano Reggiano PDO 36 months: 150g grated LAPA
  • ‚úÖ Butter: 80g (20g/person)
  • ‚úÖ White onion: 1/2 small (50g)
  • ‚úÖ Dry white wine: 100ml (optional but recommended)
  • ‚úÖ Extra virgin olive oil: 2 tablespoons
  • ‚úÖ Salt: to taste

Forbidden

  • ‚ùå Bouillon cube (too salty, covers Parmigiano!)
  • ‚ùå Cream (it's risotto, not cream!)
  • ‚ùå Pre-grated Parmigiano (doesn't melt!)
  • ‚ùå Other cheeses (only Parmigiano!)
  • ‚ùå Garlic, herbs (too invasive!)

Step-by-Step Recipe

1. Prepare Vegetable Broth (1 hour before)

Broth ingredients (1.5L):

  • Carrots: 2
  • Celery: 2 stalks
  • Onion: 1
  • Tomato: 1
  • Parsley: 1 bunch
  • Salt: to taste
  • Water: 2 liters
Procedure:
  • Cut vegetables coarsely
  • Boil in 2L water
  • Cook 40-50 min on low heat
  • Strain, keep hot
  • IMPORTANT: Broth must be BOILING during risotto cooking!
Quick alternative: Quality vegetable broth (NO cube!)

2. Toast Rice (5 min)

Procedure:

  • Wide thick-bottom pan (NO non-stick for risotto!)
  • Extra virgin olive oil 2 tablespoons + butter 20g
  • MEDIUM heat
  • Very finely chopped onion
  • Saut√© 3-4 min (must become transparent, NO golden!)
  • Add Carnaroli rice 320g
  • Toast 2-3 min stirring
  • Goal: Grains translucent at edges, opaque in center
Why toast?
  • Seals external starch
  • Even cooking
  • Grain stays al dente
  • Gradual starch release (creaminess!)
MISTAKE: Over-toasting = burnt, bitter rice!

3. Deglaze with White Wine (2 min)

Procedure:

  • Toasted rice
  • Raise heat to HIGH
  • Pour 100ml dry white wine
  • Stir vigorously
  • Let alcohol completely evaporate (1-2 min)
  • When you no longer smell alcohol = ready
Why wine?
  • Acidity balances butter/Parmigiano fattiness
  • Complex aroma
  • Lombard tradition
Can you omit? Yes, but loses depth!

4. Cook Risotto (16-18 min)

THE MOST IMPORTANT PART!

Procedure:

  • MEDIUM heat (constant!)
  • First ladle boiling broth (150-200ml)
  • Stir gently but constantly
  • When broth absorbed: Add another ladle
  • Repeat for 16-18 minutes total
  • Taste after 14 min: grain must still be hard in center
  • At 16-17 min: Perfect al dente grain (slight resistance to bite)
  • Turn off heat 1 minute BEFORE ideal cooking
Broth quantity: About 1-1.2L total (varies!)

Consistency: Risotto must be "all'onda" (waves in plate if tilted)

CRUCIAL: To Stir or Not to Stir?

ALWAYS STIR! (contrary to what many say)

Why stir:

  • Releases starch from grain (creaminess!)
  • Even cooking
  • Prevents sticking
  • Perfect emulsion
Movement: Gentle, from bottom upward, circular

5. Mantecatura (3 min) - THE MAGIC MOMENT!

Starred mantecatura procedure:

  • Turn off heat (ALWAYS off heat!)
  • Add cold butter 60g cubed
  • Parmigiano Reggiano 100g freshly grated
  • Salt if necessary (little! Parmigiano is salty)
  • Stir VIGOROUSLY 2-3 minutes
  • Movement: Toss pan back-forth (chef move!)
  • Add broth if too thick (30-50ml)
  • Goal: Creamy, velvety, "all'onda"
Perfect mantecatura test:
  • Tilt pan: risotto slides slowly like lava
  • Texture: Liquid velvet, NO grainy
  • Flavor: Intense but delicate Parmigiano
MISTAKE #1: Mantecatura with heat on = Parmigiano clumps!

MISTAKE #2: Little butter/Parmigiano = Dry, flat risotto!

MISTAKE #3: Pre-grated Parmigiano = Lumps, doesn't melt!

6. Plate and Serve

Procedure:

  • Deep plates HOT (heat before!)
  • Pour risotto in center
  • Level gently with spoon
  • Sprinkle Parmigiano Reggiano 50g (generous!)
  • Optional: Parmigiano shavings with vegetable peeler
  • Optional: Drizzle raw extra virgin olive oil (fragrant!)
  • Serve IMMEDIATELY (risotto doesn't wait!)
Presentation: Risotto must "wave" in plate, not be a solid mound!

Common Mistakes (and Solutions)

‚ùå Mistake #1: Gluey/Clumpy Risotto

Cause: Too much released starch, stirred too aggressively

Solution:

  • Stir GENTLY (don't whisk!)
  • Correct toasting (seals starch)
  • Carnaroli (releases less starch than Arborio)

‚ùå Mistake #2: Dry Risotto

Cause: Overcooked, little broth, insufficient mantecatura

Solution:

  • Turn off 1 min before ideal cooking
  • Add broth in mantecatura
  • Generous butter/Parmigiano (80g+150g!)
  • Serve immediately (dries quickly!)

‚ùå Mistake #3: Soupy Risotto

Cause: Too much broth, insufficient cooking

Solution:

  • Add broth gradually (ladle at a time!)
  • Cook 17-18 min (NO less!)
  • Mantecatura absorbs liquid

‚ùå Mistake #4: Grains Too Hard

Cause: Insufficient cooking, cold broth

Solution:

  • Cook 18-20 min if necessary
  • Broth ALWAYS boiling!
  • Taste every 2 min after 14 min

‚ùå Mistake #5: Flat Flavor

Cause: Cube broth, short-aged Parmigiano, little salt

Solution:

  • Homemade broth (authentic flavor!)
  • 36-month Parmigiano LAPA (intense!)
  • Salt gradually during cooking

Why is Carnaroli the Best?

  • Create velvety texture
  • Balance Parmigiano saltiness
  • Make risotto "all'onda"

FAQ Parmigiano Risotto

CARNAROLI! (without doubt for Parmigiano risotto)

Why:

  • Holds cooking perfectly
  • Creamy without being gluey
